title: Bottle dynamo
text:
A bottle dynamo or sidewall dynamo is a small <a href="electrical%20generator">electrical generator</a> for <a href="bicycles">bicycles</a> employed to power a bicycle's <a href="bicycle%20lighting">lights</a>. The traditional bottle dynamo (pictured) is not actually a <a href="dynamo">dynamo</a> at all (which creates <a href="Direct%20current">DC</a> power), but a low-power <a href="magneto">magneto</a> that generates <a href="Alternating%20current">AC</a>. Newer models can include a <a href="rectifier">rectifier</a> to create DC output to charge batteries for electronic devices including <a href="cellphones">cellphones</a> or <a href="GPS%20receiver">GPS receiver</a>s.
Named after their resemblance to bottles, these generators are also called "sidewall dynamos" because they operate using a roller placed on the sidewall of a <a href="bicycle%20tire">bicycle tire</a>. When the bicycle is in motion and the dynamo roller is engaged, electricity is generated as the tire spins the roller.
Two other dynamo systems used on bicycles are <a href="hub%20dynamo">hub dynamo</a>s and bottom bracket dynamos.
